lead_paragraph: GANELES--Robert I.,M.D., of Westport, Connecticut passed away May 24, 2016. His encyclopedic knowledge, wisdom, insight, humor and charm will be missed and remembered with joy and love. He was a pioneer in the field of psychopharmacology. A graduate of Brooklyn College and Baylor School of Medicine and completed his internship, residency and fellowship in Psychiatry and was board certified in Psychiatry and Neurology. He was on staff at North Shore University Hospital for over 50 years and served as the President of the Medical Board. He also served as a Captain in the U.S. Air Force. He never fully forgave his beloved Brooklyn Dodgers for leaving, but retained a lifelong love of baseball. He was an avid Mets fan and baseball statistics aficionado. He was a lifelong reader and expert crossword puzzler. He is survived by his wife of 60 years, Ceily, daughters Mara and Tami, son-in-law Bruce, and grandchildren, Samuel, Rayna and Lila. 1/3
